data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
CI: Add tmate debugging

This commit adds the option of running the GitHub workflow manually
(workflow_dispatch) and optionally enable tmate for SSH debugging.

data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
CI: Update to actions/checkout@v4

This fixes the following warning:

    Node.js 16 actions are deprecated. Please update the following actions to use Node.js 20: actions/checkout@v3. For more information see: https://github.blog/changelog/2023-09-22-github-actions-transitioning-from-node-16-to-node-20/.

data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
Add bytes to python3 string types

This means that `bytes` will now also be base64-decoded, which fixes the following tests on python3:

* test_dictionary_with_uint8_array_bytes
* test_dictionary_with_uint8_array_bytes_unencoded
* test_dictionary_with_3uint8_array_bytes

On python2, `bytes` is just an alias for `str`, which is why it worked
without this.

data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
Deepcopy type lists

This fixes a bug introduced in 35f12383a and caught by
test_dictionary_with_numpy_conversions: Without the deepcopy,
python_int_types is mutated by merging the dictionaries, which leads to
all int entries in the ros_to_python_type_map dictionary being the same.

This makes the function almost 3x faster.

data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
perf: Reorder type checks

Perform the cheaper checks first. This results in a speedup of about
1.2x.

data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
perf: Avoid regex in is_ros_binary_type

This makes is_ros_binary_type almost 5x faster and as a result the whole
convert_ros_message_to_dictionary function almost 2x faster.

data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
Compare types, not type names; improve error message

Old error message:

    TypeError: Wrong type: '1.0' must be float64

New error message:

    TypeError: Field 'x' has wrong type <type 'numpy.float64'> (valid types: [<type 'int'>, <type 'float'>])

data.author: Martin Günther
data.message:
Decode base64-encoded byte arrays as unicode

This changes the behavior for binary array message fields (uint8[],
char[] etc.) that are converted to dictionaries as follows:

* in python2: type "str"   -> type "unicode"
* in python3: type "bytes" -> type "str"

This should be okay, because the result of calling standard_b64decode on
those fields doesn't change.

This change is required for python3 compatibility, because the "bytes"
type cannot be serialized to json. This broke the following tests:

* test_json_message_converter.test_ros_message_with_3uint8_array
* test_json_message_converter.test_json_with_string

data.author: Jean-Baptiste Doyon
data.message:
Removes unnecessary dependency on ROS master node (#18)

The rospy.init_node method was being called (for creating
timestamps with now's time), but using the python time module for
seeding the object is sufficient (wall-clock).

Removes the rospy.init_node calls, which turns the whole test class
into a UNIT test WITHOUT need for a ROS master node.

data.author: Jb DOYON
data.message:
Fixes fixed-size uint8 arrays differential treatment (#15)

* Adds tests for uint8[] and uint8[3] to message converter

This test shows that uint8 arrays of fixed size are handled
differently (interpreted to be array of numbers, where uint8[] is
considered byte string), which shouldn't be the case.

Reproduces Github Issue #5, test code inspired by PR #8.

* Fixes GitHub issue #5

The check for ROS binary types was a simple "in" check for uint8[] and
char[]. This implied fixed-size uint8 array fail the check and were
considered "regular" type arrays, with no base64 encoding in sight.

Fixed by making the binary type check a regex-match on the data type,
refactored into a separate function.

All tests now pass.

* Adds test for json conversion of fixed size uint8 array

Also, updates the ros->dict type check to use regex instead of
now-defunct ros_binary_types array (woopsie)
